page.title: 17Ecology of South Bradford.
page.content: Since Bradford began a system of{smoke {less zoning}in the{1960's}the City has become a much better place to live in.Before the clean up the area suffered from terrible{'pea soup' fogs which hung about for days.This along with rows of dirty,black,back to back houses did not paint a pretty picture and even on clear days the many mill chimneys poured out{thick black smoke. Much of this has now disappeared.The mills have closed down or changed the fuel they used.Many of the terrace houses have been demolished or the back to back houses have been improved and made into through properties.Their walls have been sand blasted and these houses look like new.The local council has spent money on tree and shrub planting on these streets to give the final touch to the improvements.
